sentence.idiomatic: How come you're so slow? We've all been waiting half the day for you.
You've been thinking for half the day. Quickly tell us your answer.
I rang the doorbell for half a day, it's just that no one came to open the door. They are definitely not at home.
Today we will practice backing the car up.
She just got her driver's license yesterday, so when she backs up the car she is still a little bit flustered.
By looking at her, she definitely is a beginner. It would be best if you go help her to back up.
Quick, look! His appearance is so hilarious.
Her performance just now was very funny.
His amusing and funny movements certainly won everyone's applause.
You schmuck! What business is it of yours?
I haven't seen you in over a year, and your old bad habits haven't changed at all.
That you could take first place at your lame level I really can't believe.
Admitting one's own shortcomings is by no means a disgraceful thing.
Only when I went to pay the bill did I discover that I hadn't brought any money--how embarrassing.
Yesterday she did a very embarrassing thing.
I'll drink my wine, it's none of your business.
Whether I have money or not, it's none of your business.
I'll go where I want to go, it's none of your business.
We don't want to waste time. Hurry up and do your work.
How come you got a new MP3 player again? It's really a waste of money.
Eat all of these things up. Don't waste food.

word.literal: who does he think he is

sentence.idiomatic: What's so big about him? I'm not afraid of him.

word.literal: who do you think you are

sentence.idiomatic: Who do you think you are? How dare you getting involved in my business.

word.literal: who does he think he is

sentence.idiomatic: Who does he think he is? When he meets me he'll have to pay his respects.
What's the hurry? Rushing off to be reincarnated?
He's in such a hurry. Is he rushing of to get reincarnated?
Don't rush. It's not like your rushing off to get reincarnated.
Let me teach him a lesson.
Last night she got a lecture from dad, so today she's in a bad mood.
We really should teach him a good lesson.
You jerk!
The person who randomly parked his car here is a jerk.
Whoever yells at people is a jerk.
Can you drive a car or not? You've been backing up for half the day and still can't get in.
It's you who can't drive. With you following me so close, how can I back up?
Isn't that hilarious? You don't own the road. Your own skills suck, and you start blaming other people? If you can't drive then you shouldn't come out and embarrass yourself.
Hey, I'll drive my car. You mind your own business!
If you waste my time, of course it's my business.

word.literal: who do you think you are

sentence.idiomatic: Who do you think you are? What do you have to do that's so important? In a big hurry to be reincarnated?
All right pal, I see today you're cruisin' for a bruisin'. I'll teach you a lesson today, or my name isn't Wang.
Everyone knows your name is Wang, Wang the jerk.
[sound of a fight]

word.literal: who do you think you are
